Comments_List: Developed better proficiency in Chinese language, grammar, characters, and syntax.
How to speak and write Chinese (and read Chinese)
I learned how to speak more conversational Chinese.
I learned more about the Chinese language, mainly how to speak and write it. Also, I learned more about Chinese culture.

I gained confidence in my speaking, writing, and especially reading Chinese. This course really does wonders in helping you progress in a language, something especially impressive considering the language is something as hard as Chinese.

I feel like a strength of this course is that everything was very well organized and the schedules were easy to follow. However a weakness is the tests can be ambiguous when words can be translated into english with multiple meaning causing for some confusion.
This class teaches chinese very well. The classes are small and the teachers are very nice

I think the course gave me all the tools to speak Chinese. For example, the grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciations were all taught well. However, I still have trouble speaking in spontaneous situations. So, I think adding more speaking exercises that aren't rehearsed would benefit me.
I wish we used old characters more. We learn so many characters, and sometimes use one only once, so it's extremely easy to forget it.
Great course overall. I think it would be more beneficial to record the dialogues similar to how the heritage classes do it rather than memorize them for class.
Yes, if you are interested in Chinese. You definitely need to like learning languages to enjoy learning Chinese since it is a very difficult language to pick up.
